com.milk.uberchat.base
Class BaseUser

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseLocus
              |
              +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseChannelHolder
                    |
                    +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseUser
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatChannelHolder, ChatEntity, ChatLocus, ChatUser, Commandable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ICBUser, IRCUser, SBUser
public abstract class BaseUser
extends BaseChannelHolder
implements ChatUser

This is an abstract base class that provides a lot of what all ChatUser implementors need.

Note that BaseUser completely takes care of setting the description for its ChatEntity nature, so subclasses should not call BaseEntity.setDescription(). Unfortunately, Java doesn't provide a way to specify this restriction programatically. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

BaseUser

                ChatIdentity targetIdentity,
                java.lang.String nickname)
Construct a BaseUser. It starts out with an empty channels list.

Parameters:
name - the name for this user
targetIdentity - the target identity for this user
nickname - null-ok; the initial nickname for the user
Method Detail

getNickname

public final java.lang.String getNickname()
Get the nickname/description of this user. Should return "" and not null if the chat system doesn't support nicknames.

Specified by:
getNickname in interface ChatUser
Returns:
non-null; the nickname/description of the user

getNameNickCombo

public final java.lang.String getNameNickCombo()
Get the standard "name/nick" combo string. This returns either the full combination, or merely the name if the nickname is either empty or identical to the name.

Specified by:
getNameNickCombo in interface ChatUser
Returns:
the name/nick combo

updateUsers

public final void updateUsers()
Update the list of users in this locus. In this case, it does nothing, since the set of users for a BaseUsers is constant.

Specified by:
updateUsers in interface ChatLocus
Specified by:
updateUsers in class BaseLocus

uberBroadcast

protected void uberBroadcast(BaseEvent event)

Broadcast an event to the appropriate uber-listeners of this entity. BaseUser uses this to send the event to its ChatIdentity parent, but only if the parent is in fact a BaseEntity.

To repeat the note from BaseEntity: Subclasses may override this to send to additional listeners or perform needed actions, but overriding methods must call super.uberBroadcast(). Java has no way to enforce this, however. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Overrides:
uberBroadcast in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
event - the event to send

channelAdded

protected void channelAdded(ChatChannel channel)
BaseChannelHolder calls this method when a channel has been added. We use this to make sure that the channel is known to the identity and that the channel knows about the user, keeping everything in synch. These things only work if the target identity of the user is in fact a BaseChannelHolder, and the channel is in fact a BaseLocus.

Overrides:
channelAdded in class BaseChannelHolder
Parameters:
channel - the channel that was added

channelRemoved

protected void channelRemoved(ChatChannel channel)
BaseChannelHolder calls this method when a channel has been removed. We use this to make sure the channel's user list doesn't contain this object, but we can only do this if the channel is in fact a BaseLocus.

Overrides:
channelRemoved in class BaseChannelHolder
Parameters:
channel - the channel that was removed

nameChanged

protected void nameChanged()
BaseEntity calls this when the name and/or canonical name of this object changes. We use this to re-make the description, since it is in part based on the name.

Overrides:
nameChanged in class BaseEntity

nicknameChanged

protected final void nicknameChanged(java.lang.String nickname)
Tell this BaseUser that the nickname has changed.

Parameters:
nickname - null-ok; the new nickname for the channel
